edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Controls

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Controls

  • public class Controls
extends java.lang.Object
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud). The hud is a place for displaying text and drawing touchable buttons, so that as the hero moves through the level, the buttons and text can remain at the same place on the screen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Controls.Control
      This is for handling everything that gets drawn on the HUD, whether it is pressable or not

    • Method Detail

      • addCountdown

        public static Controls.Control addCountdown(float timeout,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int x,
                            int y)
        Add a countdown timer to the screen. When time is up, the level ends in defeat
        Parameters:
        timeout - Starting value of the timer
        text - The text to display when the timer expires
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)

      • addCountdown

        public static Controls.Control addCountdown(float timeout,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            java.lang.String fontName,
                            int red,
                            int green,
                            int blue,
                            int size)
        Add a countdown timer to the screen, with extra features for describing the appearance of the font. When time is up, the level ends in defeat.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Starting value of the timer
        text - The text to display when the timer expires
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontname - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)

        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)

      • addGoodieCount

        public static Controls.Control addGoodieCount(int type,
                              int max,
                              java.lang.String text,
                              int x,
                              int y,
                              java.lang.String fontName,
                              int red,
                              int green,
                              int blue,
                              int size)
        Add a count of the current number of goodies of the specified type, with extra features for describing the appearance of the font
        Parameters:
        type - The type of goodie to show (1-4)
        max - If this is > 0, then the message wil be of the form XX/max instead of just XX
        text - The text to display after the number of goodies
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontname - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)

      • addPauseButton

        public static Controls.Control addPauseButton(int x,
                              int y,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              java.lang.String imgName)
        Add a button that pauses the game by causing a PauseScene to be displayed. Note that you must configure a PauseScene, or pressing this button will cause your game to crash.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button

      • addMoveButton

        public static Controls.Control addMoveButton(int x,
                             int y,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             java.lang.String imgName,
                             PhysicsSprite entity,
                             float dx,
                             float dy)
        Add a button that moves an entity
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        entity - The entity to move downward
        dx - The new X velocity
        dy - The new Y velocity

        entity - The entity to move downward

      • addTurboButton

        public static Controls.Control addTurboButton(int x,
                              int y,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              java.lang.String imgName,
                              int rateDownX,
                              int rateDownY,
                              int rateUpX,
                              int rateUpY,
                              PhysicsSprite entity)
        Add a button that moves the given entity at one speed when it is depressed, and at another otherwise
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        rateDownX - Rate (X) at which the entity moves when the button is pressed
        rateDownY - Rate (Y) at which the entity moves when the button is pressed
        rateUpX - Rate (X) at which the entity moves when the button is not pressed
        rateUpY - Rate (Y) at which the entity moves when the button is not pressed
        entity - The entity that the button controls

      • addDampenedMotionButton

        public static Controls.Control addDampenedMotionButton(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       java.lang.String imgName,
                                       float rateX,
                                       float rateY,
                                       float dampening,
                                       PhysicsSprite entity)
        Add a button that moves the given entity at one speed, but doesn't stop the entity when the button is released
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        rateX - Rate (X) at which the entity moves when the button is pressed
        rateY - Rate (Y) at which the entity moves when the button is pressed
        entity - The entity that the button controls

        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once

      • addSingleThrowButton

                                    int y,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,

        h - The hero who should throw the projectile

      • addVectorThrowButton

        public static Controls.Control addVectorThrowButton(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int width,
                                    int height,
                                    java.lang.String imgName,
                                    Hero h,
                                    long milliDelay)
        The default behavior for throwing is to throw in a straight line. If we instead desire that the projectiles have some sort of aiming to them, we need to use this method, which throws toward where the screen was pressed Note: you probably want to use an invisible button that covers the screen...
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        h - The hero who should throw the projectile
        milliDelay - A delay between throws, so that holding doesn't lead to too many throws at once

                                          Hero h)

      • addLevelFact

        public static Controls.Control addLevelFact(java.lang.String key,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            java.lang.String fontName,
                            int red,
                            int green,
                            int blue,
                            int size,
                            java.lang.String prefix,
                            java.lang.String suffix)
        Display text corresponding to a fact saved for the current level
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up in the Fact store
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontname - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)
        prefix - Text to put before the fact
        suffix - Text to put after the fact

      • addPinchZoomControl

        public static Controls.Control addPinchZoomControl(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int width,
                                   int height,
                                   java.lang.String imgName,
                                   float maxZoom,
                                   float minZoom)
        Allow pinch-to-zoom TODO: this isn't quite right, because we are treating zoom like a touchable control, but it's really a whole-screen affair...
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        maxZoom - The maximum zoom (out) factor. 8 is usually a good choice.
        minZoom - The minimum zoom (int) factor. .25f is usually a good choice.

      • addVerticalBar

        public static Controls.Control addVerticalBar(int x,
                              int y,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              java.lang.String imgName,
                              int id,
                              PhysicsSprite entity)
        Add an image to the heads-up display that changes its clipping rate to seem to grow vertically, without stretching. Touching the image causes its scale (0-100) to be sent to a ControlPressEntity event
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        id - The id to use when this generates an onControlPressTrigger event
        entity - An entity that can be passed to the onControlPressTrigger event

      • addRotator

        public static Controls.Control addRotator(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height,
                          java.lang.String imgName,
                          float delta,
                          int id,
                          PhysicsSprite entity)
        Add a rotating button that generates a ControlPressEntity event and passes the rotation to the handler.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        imgName - The name of the image to display. Use "" for an invisible button
        delta - Amount of rotation to add during each fraction of a second
        id - The id to use when this generates an onControlPressTrigger event
        entity - An entity that can be passed to the onControlPressTrigger event
